name: The Name Game
description: The Name Game is a simple icebreaker game that helps people learn each other's names. Each person says their name along with an adjective that starts with the same letter.
basicRules: The first person says their name and an adjective that starts with the same letter (e.g., 'Jumping Jack').
The next person has to remember the first person's name and adjective, and then say their own (e.g., 'Jumping Jack, and I'm Creative Cathy').
This continues around the circle, with each person having to remember the names and adjectives of all the people who came before them.
If someone makes a mistake, the group can help them out.
The game ends when it gets back to the first person, who has to try to remember everyone's name and adjective.
tips: Choose an adjective that is easy to remember.
Use gestures or actions to help people remember your adjective.
Don't worry if you make a mistake, the point is to have fun and learn names.
